titleStmt.title: An Encoded Transcription of Material from the Sylvia Beach Papers

msIdentifier.repository: Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections

change.ab: Transcribed cards s7: "parcel from" = "reposlape"? s8: Not a Joyce card, for "Mrs. Eugene Jolas" s9: Principles of Freedom = "Mar" or "Mai," not sure which (and true for rest of card)

body.ab:
1933 JOYCE Mr. Stanislaus 6 via Cesare Battista Trieste 25 April The Joyce Book Frs. 200.00 postage 13.40 213.40 paid 5 May 50f 19 June 50f June 50 July 63.40 not paid acknowledge payment each time
1933 Mr. Joyce 17 June A.B.C. of Economics 14.50 20 " " " " 14 00 10 Feb 1934 Chaucer 14 Feb 10 gave JJ bill 70 50 paid by cheque March 7 Frs 70 still owes 0.50 May 4 The Joyce Book No 108 170,00 June 4 paid by cheque 170 frs 17 June 18 2 copies the Mime 100 " paid by cheque 100v June 16 1 copy the Mime 50 " to be sent to Bennett Cerf, Savoy Hotel, London postage 5 More Pricks than Kicks 30 June 22 paid by cheque 85 June 22 1copy the Mime sent to Mr Burton 50 29 1 c. Mr. Brauchbar 50 postage 5 1 c. Mr. Healy 50 postage 5 1 c. Mr. Goll 50 post. 1.80 The Rock 10.75 post 1.40 Sent bill - 29 June 223.95 cheque July 13 250 00 223 95 credit JJ 26 05, (26.05)
Mr. Joyce 18 Dec. Jan 1933 Criterion 37f 50 pd 1433 Jan-March Hound + Horn 16-- 28 Jan. Adventures of the Black 14- Girl postage PP to Pinker 2.60 Jan 30 Ulysses in French (new copy) Revue des Deux Mondes containing Gillet's article on Work in Progress Aug 1930 Feb 2 Joyce Book Sweeeney Agonistes HCE 1st Eng ed. 22 A.L.P. (to Leonhard:) 5 7-
account March 25 Martin Chuzzlewit 10,00 30 Yeats' Poems 36 A Portrait of the Artist 27 May 1 ALP (to Leonhard) 4 50 77 50 cheque May 5 by Miss Weaver 70 balance due = 7.50 May 8 Chaucer Oxford ed sent 14 to Mr Reece post. 7 28 50
1935. Mr JOYCE.
1934 - 13 July. credit. 26.05. 24 Jan. More pricks than kicks. 33.00. McGreevy, Poems- 16.50 postage 5.90 55.90 21 Aug. 2c Transition 23. 53f 50 post. paid by 2.60 cheque 27 Aug 2 Sept. 2. Transition. 50.00. sent unregistered to Louis Gillet Hotel Savoy London. Curtis Bonn. pd by Leon. Sept 11 p. 6.60 Oct 5. Dierdre Synge. Nov 2. Nov. 9. Synge's Works. 57.75 postage. 2.40 Nov 26. paid 60v by cheque 60.15 1936. March 24 Etched in Moonlight + post.27.65 March 25. pd by cheque. 30.00 -27.65 credit 2.35 April 3. Dubliners. 33.00. Huckleberry Finn. 8.50 Work in Progress. 24.00. Echo's Bones. 12.00. July 28 pd by cheque 70v. July 28 Franklyns Autobiography+post. 11.50 (owes) Sept 10 Our Exagmination. 15.00 26 50
carried forward 26.50 Sept. 18. Our Exagmination 15.00 postage 3.80 45.30 Sept 21. Our Exagmination 2 copies 30.00 postage 7.00 82.30 Paid by cheque Sept 23 1936 85.00. Credit. Oct 31 lent to JJ Shaw: Quintessance of Ibsenism Oct 31 Our Exagmination 15,00 Nov. Hone. Life of George Moore 82.50 paid 97.50 Nov 23 paid by cheque 100,00 97 50 credit 2,50 1937 Feb 17 The Secret Language of Ireland paid Feb 88 17 cash by JJ July 21. 1 Chamber music. 25.00 sent to Mr Edmund Pendleton postage 2 00 1 A.L.P. 9.00 Sent to Mme Frohnknecht postage 2.00 38.00 received cheque July 30

1932 I JOLAS 58 9 rue Borghèse Neuilly/Seine Mrs Eugene Jolas 40 bis rue de Sevigné Paris 4 March 9 Montessori vol I 30 " vol II 45 paid 9 rue Borthèse Neuilly March 24 207,50 SB owed for Transition 179 90 Mrs Jolas owes balance Frs 27,60 sent bill Aug 30 paid Sept 21 1932 31 Dec. 2 Standard Service Arithmetics 60-- postage 3.20 21 Jan 1933 bill sent 63.20 paid by m.o. Feb 22 1933 March 6 Early Farmers 20 Suggestions to teachers 20 post 2 60 paid m.o. 6 July 1933 42.60 July 4 Tertium Organum (will keep till Sept) Oct 23 p.c. Oct 19

Dec 6 Principles of Freedom 3 by Terence MacSweeney 1 Dec 7 ta Hio: The Great Learning, E. Pound Mai 3 Chinese Written Character Mai 3 Feb 28 Mr J.J. asked SB to 1939 sell him there books (March 2 SB sold Mr Léon books o.p. couldn't sell)
